title: Understanding Rotation of Axes
text: When you rotate a conic section with respect to the axes, you can eliminate the 'xy' term, simplifying the equation. This process often reveals the nature of the conic more clearly.

title: Using Trigonometric Identities
text:
To rotate a conic through angle θ, you'll need to use the trigonometric identities:
$$x'=x cos\left(	hetaight)-y sin\left(	hetaight)$$
$$y'=x sin\left(	hetaight)+y cos\left(	hetaight)$$
These help in converting the xy-term into a simpler form or eliminating it.

title: Applying the Rotation Formula
text: Given the angle of rotation θ, replace the $$x$$ and $$y$$ in the conic equation with the transformed coordinates x' and y'. Calculate the new coefficients for x' and y'. What does the equation look like now?

title: Understanding the Discriminant
text: The discriminant of a conic section, ax² + bxy + cy² + dx + ey + f $$=$$ $$0$$, is Δ $$=$$ b² - 4ac. This value helps identify the nature of the conic: ellipse, parabola, or hyperbola.
